result.execSummary:
The defendant Sergio Nmi Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500 + costs = $1083 + $100 domestic abuse surcharge = $1183 + $165 subpoena fees = $1348; due in $35 incriments per month, beginning 4/30/16 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 28 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 

To submit a DNA Sample to JCJ, DOC or other designee upon demand

Case called at 8:33 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Sergio Nmi Garcia in court with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court AMENDS Count #2 dismissing the domestic repeater, making this charge a misdemeanor. 

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #2 as amended; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count#1

On Count #2, the Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $500 + costs = $1083 + $100 domestic abuse surcharge = $1183 + $165 subpoena fees = $1348; due in $35 incriments per month, beginning 4/30/16 and on the last day of the month until paid in full. Non-payment results in a 28 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive. 
To submit a DNA Sample to JCJ, DOC or other designee upon demand
Upon questioning of Atty Gonzalez, the Court indicates that Mr. Garcia can check with jail staff regarding removal of the SCRAM otherwise there is WCS staff in the courthouse.
Recess: 8:45 am
Plea hearing on April 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 2:01 pm [Clerk SH] (Final Status Scheduling Conference)
Defendant Sergio Nmi Garcia in court with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel confirm they are ready to proceed to trial as scheduled
Court informs parties that there is one other case scheduled on the same date/time that is more serious than this matter and that that case is scheduled next week for FSSC
Court directs Atty Gonzalez to call the Court's judicial assistant April 1st in the afternoon to see if this case will proceed to trial as scheduled or be rescheduled
Atty Gonzalez informs the Court that due to the other acts motion, assigned prosecutor and self agree 2 days are needed for trial

1 alternate; 5 strikes each
jurors may take notes and ask questions
Atty Gonzalez informs the Court that there are No Miranda Goodchild issues; Court directs State that if there are statements from the Defendant the State plans on using that are not in discovery, those statements must be brought to the defense and Court's attention before they put in front of the jury
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Gonzalez indicates that all negotiation efforts have been exhausted and that he does not see an agreement forthcoming
Court reminds Mr. Garcia that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while the case is pending
Recess: 2:05 pm

NEXT:  Trial to remain as scheduled - Atty Gonzalez to contact the Court 4/1/16 to see if case will proceed to trial as scheduled

Case called at 10:43 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant Sergio Nmi Garcia in court with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gonzalez informs the Court that matter has not been settled. Spoke with ADA Hall off-record, as fairly new on matter are requesting an adjournment of the trial
ADA Hall informs the Court that the State does not object to request, did anticipate request
Atty Gonzalez presents further basis for request including earlier other acts motion investigation is still on-going
Court grants motion for adjournment and informs parties that It will schedule trial dates off-record
Court reminds Mr. Garcia that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
off-record: 10:46 - 10:48 am
Court announces dates for the record
Court informs Mr. Garcia that the last date for him to enter a plea is the FSSC date
Recess: 10:49 am

NEXT: (1) Reschedule FSSC 3/24/16 at 1:30 pm - Send notices (2) Reschedule JT 4/4-5/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Cover letter from Attorney Gonzalez for the Notice of Appointment and Appearance and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Notice of Appointment and Appearance- Attorney Gonzalez

Case called at 8:35 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Sergio Nmi Garcia in court with Attorney John Paul Marchan. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court presents intial analysis/impressions of motions for parties based on filings

Court presents basis and grants State's motions to admit wrongs, other crimes, prior bad acts and Defense motion to admit McMorris evidence. 

On State's Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions:
Court finds that Mr. Garcia has 10 prior convictions for impeachment purposes - directs Mr. Garcia
off-record: 8:41 - 9:08 am for counsel to discuss some matters
Atty Marchan informs the Court that matter is not settled. Mr. Garcia is requesting new counsel, he indicates that he is not satisfied - just informed today. Would qualify for another SPD as am 1st appointment, trial is 60 days out, so do believe new counsel would be on board and ready by trial.
Court allows Atty Marchan to withdraw, informs Mr. Garcia that it is unlikely another substitution of counsel will be granted without compeling circumstances. Trial dates will remain as scheduled.
Upon questioning of the Court, Mr. Garcia indicates that his finances remain the same as when he first applied for SPD services.
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Marchan indicates that he will contact SPD and inform them that he has been withdrawn and new counsel needs to be appointed.
Recess: 9:13 am 

NEXT: Case to remain as scheduled

Case called at 1:55 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant Sergio Nmi Garcia in court with Attorney John Paul Marchan. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel jointly request continuance, presents bases including filing of motions
Court grants rquest, given joint request - Counsel agree 1 hour will be needed for motion
Recess: 2:01 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Motion Hearing 1/4/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices (2) Reschedule FSSC & JT - Send notices **Atty Marchan to speak with Court's JA**

Case called at 2:05 pm [sf] [Case was set for Status]
Defendant Sergio Nmi Garcia in court with Attorney John Paul Marchan. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Garcia waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment & Trial.
State files information.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

ADA Teuber advises that one day would be needed for trial.
Attorney Marchan also believes that one day for trial is needed.
ADA Teuber indicates that a date in November would be best anticipates ADA Hall will be filing other motions.

Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending.

recess: 2:11 pm

ADDRESS INFO for Sergio Nmi Garcia
Current: 1922 Elizabeth St, Janesville, WI 53545 United States  (Effective: 07-28-2015)
Prior: 905 Garity Street, Jefferson, WI 53549

[MK] case called at 1:29pm. 
Defendant Sergio Nmi Garcia appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500 signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Martha Garcia or with their daughter 
--Mr. Garcia may return to the residence one time before Wednesday [7/15/15] at 4:00pm in the presence of the police to collect his possessions 
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
-The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.  The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Mr. Garcia is not to be released from Jail until he has the SCRAM bracelet is installed.   **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
recess 1:35pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/19/15 at 10:00am,  (2) Status Conferenceon 9/8/15 at 9:30am.
